page.title: 13BEAUMONT SHOPPING COMPLEX
page.content: The rapidly expanding population (estimated to be 29,000 by 1993) made the provision of a large shopping centre imperative. 250,000 sq ft of development has been built up as a self contained village consisting of : 41 shops, 7 lock-up shops, 19 flats, a covered market, a superstore and free car-parking for 1260 cars. The centre has been designed to blend in with the landscape giving the feel of streets rather than a formal precinct. Completed in May 1984, it is situated 3 miles to the NW of the city centre with links to the A6, A50, M1 and M69. It is a pedestrianised precinct, the focal point of which is a covered market. The main superstore, Tesco, has 44 checkouts, covers 58,000 sq ft and is used by 38,000 people a week. It is the biggest Tesco in the country and even provides free buses.
